title: Beyonce reigns in gold gown during surprise appearance at grand opening of Tyler Perry Studios
text:
She may have skipped the red carpet, but Beyonce Knowles-Carter's presence at the historic grand opening of Tyler Perry Studios did not go unnoticed.

The 38-year-old cultural icon looked regal in a gold sequined gown as she made a surprise appearance at the Atlanta event on Saturday.

The long sleeve floor-length gown featured a high neckline and tight bodice that hugged her voluptuous curves.

Reign supreme: Beyonce Knowles-Carter, 38, looked regal in a gold sequined gown as she made a surprise appearance at the historic grand opening of Tyler Perry Studios in Atlanta on Saturday

Eagle-eyed fans noticed actress Keke Palmer wore a similar dress at the 2019 MTV VMAs back in August.

The designer of Palmer's dress, Yousef Al Jasmi, has worked with Bey before, so it wouldn't be far off to assume it's the same dress.

Queen Bey accessorized her look with silver rings and diamond-encrusted drop earrings as she carried a mint-colored clutch.

Adding to the colorful ensemble, the Halo hitmaker sported a red-orange lipstick, while the rest of her make-up was more muted.

Pop of color: Adding to the colorful ensemble, the Halo hitmaker sported a red-orange lipstick, while the rest of her make-up was more muted

Bling! Queen Bey accessorized her look with silver rings and diamond-encrusted drop earrings

Sisterhood of the traveling dress: Eagle-eyed fans noticed actress Keke Palmer wore a similar dress at the 2019 MTV VMAs back in August

Beyoncé wore her long raven locks in an extra long and sleek braid.

Not seen at the event was her husband of 11 years, Jay-Z.

Beyoncé's mom, Tina Knowles, was also at the event wearing an intricate black suit dress.

Family affair: Beyonce's mom, Tina Knowles, 65, was also at the event wearing an intricate black suit dress

The celebratory gala has a dual purpose: to unveil Atlanta's new Tyler Perry Studios and to pay homage to the actors who have inspired his journey from homelessness to history-making.

The 330-acre filming complex is the first major Black-owned movie studio in American history, as well as one of the largest production studios in the country in general.

With 12 soundstages, 40 buildings on-site that are listed on the National Register of Historic Places and more than 200 acres of green space, Tyler Perry Studios aren't only making history, they've got an interesting past as well.

Perry bought Fort McPherson, a former Confederate military base, back in 2015 for $250 million and it's now the site of his massive studio.

History in the making: Tyler Perry, 50, bought Fort McPherson, a former Confederate military base, back in 2015 for $250 million and it's now the site of his massive studio

The Diary of a Mad Black Woman star spoke about the historic studio while accepting the ultimate icon award at the BET Awards in June.

'That studio was once a Confederate Army base... which meant that there was Confederate soldiers on that base plotting and planning on how to keep 3.9 million Negroes enslaved,' he said.

'Now, that land is owned by one Negro,' he said to a standing ovation, adding, 'It's all about trying to help somebody across.'

'While everybody was fighting for a seat at the table, talking about: "Oscars so white, Oscars so white," I said, "Y'all go ahead and do that, but while you're fighting for a seat at the table, I'll be down in Atlanta building my own,"' Perry said.
